name: Thomas McLean
biography:
Thomas McLean (1788 - 1875) was a print seller and publisher from London.

McLean specialized in the publication of political caricatures. His works were published in journals such as the Monthly Sheet of Caricatures.

He was a respected dealer of art and print and annually held exhibitions for watercolor and oil paintings. He also supported young, but not well-known artists.

His business was located on Haymarket Street in London. After his death in 1875, the business was taken over by his son, Thomas Miller McLean.
